channel.title: KenSmith tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from KenSmith.

item.description: NYC, what is it about you? https://t.co/uWXgVaGYKZ
Patti Smith, charmed by all the good energy in the air, receiving an honorary doctorate at Columbia’s graduation on Wednesday. https://t.co/XElKhqS4HU
Newly minted doctors of some kind or another. https://t.co/ZTwI7j3bkp
Halo advertisement on top of a taxi outside St. Pat’s. https://t.co/OoKikpjCKP
Halfway through Pennsylvania. https://t.co/FRe53NgwMv
Pennsylvania taco stand so far from the city that it had its own ATM. https://t.co/q0NRa6RmrF
If both great speeches and propaganda simplify, repeat, sloganize and fuel emotion, where does that leave citizens of an imperiled democracy? @JeffreyNussbaum @TheCityClub

On Tuesday, in a shady alcove in a great city park, someone who was the spitting image of @RealChalamet tuned his acting chops by offering free performances of Shakespeare monologues for anyone interested who came by. Long, intricate, intimate progressions of thought and emotion. https://t.co/bpiKshn84O
We chatted briefly about the line before “Tomorrow, and tomorrow, and tomorrow . . . “ when Macbeth realizes he has no time to grieve his wife’s death: “She should have died hereafter; there would have been time for such a word.”
Then the actor gave the context for the prison speech from Richard II, and then went into character for that lengthy and meditative speech.
I have been studying how I may compare This prison where I live unto the world: . . .
https://t.co/PDkqIOmCEC
Hilary Clinton is called to the podium for a minute-long speech about the work to be done. https://t.co/1OTm7a05s3
"There is a problem of inequality resulting in differential access to higher education." --Lee C. Bollinger, President, Columbia https://t.co/zzvimWlk48
“The flowers arrive on their own because nature, true to rumors, abhors a vacuum, and our yard provides several vacuums.” https://t.co/zxTZsVEBrJ
“Journalists should report on [these kinds of document or speech], but they should mediate their propagandistic intent instead of blindly amplifying it.” https://t.co/aYzco0ptwp
Overheard on FB: "My insurance company denied the bill for the weekly checking of the surgical drain because they had not yet processed the bill for installing the surgical drain in the first place."

What’s the average age at which a typical billionaire first misjudges his ability to master a complex new field? PS. Betcha a nickel the typical billionaire doesn’t think there is any such thing as a typical billionaire.
One hundred years ago, Firestone wanted folks to know that its 32 x 4 car tire was gum-dipped. https://t.co/YIzz8F2veT
Analysis: Candidates in Republican primaries are trying to dodge journalists - CNN. https://t.co/gpk9QjjNMo

Over on the iPad, I can't scroll up or down on the Twitter screen until I tap "Got it" on the image that offers a new 38 page Terms of Service agreement and a new 19 page Privacy Policy. In the picture, a hip, cute couple are having a blast with their devices. https://t.co/DkbUwEMhlq

A game-able communication system and a game-able crowd. What else does a troll need besides a corrupt heart? PS. Sounds like Mr. Musk has announced his plan to invite the Master Troll Himself, the Once And Future President, back onto Twitter.
Please say more. https://t.co/y5np6TMh5P
Three diagnoses. (Swift saw the chaos, Baldwin pinned down the blindness, and Dewey named the untapped potential.) https://t.co/yuHeM6MRc6
The idea that the big social media corporations, by the nature of their dreams about themselves and about society, cannot be mended.
Michiana friends, don’t forget the spring wildflowers at Bendix, St. Pat’s, Potato Creek . . . https://t.co/PeP3XVO0OV
“Find your place on the planet. Dig in, and take responsibility from there.” —Gary Snyder, born on this day in 1930. Via @rayboomhower.
After 11 steps, I conclude that Facebook dearly wants me not to follow a link outside of its silo. https://t.co/Dc3iLO30ld
“. . . how we get trapped in durable systems of inequality, and how we can sometimes get out of them.” Real Review 12 https://t.co/7QHjG4ZlAa https://t.co/v3gwP4JHRv
